description: Sticky header with Apex Partners logo on left and navigation menu (Home, About, Services, Portfolio, Pricing, Contact) on right, plus 'Request a Quote' CTA button. Must remain visible on scroll and work across all pages.
steps: Navigate to any page and verify header appears at top with logo left-aligned
Scroll down page and confirm header remains sticky/fixed at top
Click each navigation link and verify correct page loads
Click 'Request a Quote' button and verify it navigates to Contact page
Resize browser to mobile width and verify hamburger menu appears with CTA still visible

description: Footer appearing on all pages with brand statement, quick links to all pages, contact details placeholder, social icons (Instagram, LinkedIn), and copyright notice. Provides consistent site-wide navigation and brand reinforcement.
steps: Navigate to any page and scroll to bottom to view footer
Verify footer contains statement: 'Apex Partners builds premium websites for brands that want to look sharp and convert.'
Click each quick link and confirm navigation to correct page
Verify Instagram and LinkedIn icons are present and styled correctly
Confirm copyright text is displayed

description: Above-the-fold hero section on homepage with headline 'Luxury websites built to convert.', subheadline explaining services, two CTA buttons (Request a Quote, View Work), and quick highlights row showing 'Fast turnaround', 'Mobile-first', 'Premium design', 'Built for growth'. Sets immediate brand tone and drives primary conversions.
steps: Navigate to homepage and verify hero section loads immediately above fold
Confirm headline 'Luxury websites built to convert.' is prominently displayed
Verify subheadline text explains multi-page sites to admin panels for target clients
Click 'Request a Quote' button and verify navigation to Contact page
Click 'View Work' button and verify navigation to Portfolio page
Verify four quick highlights are displayed in a row below CTAs

description: Trust bar displaying 'Trusted by:' followed by five client placeholder names/logos in monochrome style. Builds credibility and social proof for first-time visitors.
steps: Scroll to trust bar section on homepage below hero
Verify 'Trusted by:' label is displayed
Confirm five client placeholders are shown in a horizontal row
Verify styling is muted/monochrome matching luxury aesthetic
Check responsive behavior on mobile shows appropriate layout

description: Six luxury-style service cards on homepage: Starter Websites, Business Websites, Restaurant Websites, Barber/Salon Websites, E-Commerce, Full-Service Platforms. Each card has title, description, and 'Learn more' link to Services page. Provides quick service overview and drives deeper engagement.
steps: Navigate to services snapshot section on homepage
Verify all six service cards are displayed in grid layout
Confirm each card has title, descriptive text, and 'Learn more' link
Click 'Learn more' on any card and verify navigation to Services page
Test responsive layout on mobile to ensure cards stack appropriately
Verify luxury styling with proper spacing and typography

description: Featured work section showing 3 portfolio projects (Noir Bistro, Crown Cut Studio, Silverline Studio) with thumbnails, project type, one-line result, and 'View project' button. Showcases quality of work and drives portfolio exploration.
steps: Scroll to featured work section on homepage
Verify three project cards are displayed with thumbnails
Confirm each project shows name, type (Restaurant/Barber/Business), and result text
Click 'View project' button on any project and verify navigation to project detail
Check that placeholder images are monochrome/black and white
Test mobile layout for proper card stacking

description: Three-column section explaining value proposition: 'Design-led. Development-strong. Business-focused.' with details on luxury design, clean code, and conversion focus. Differentiates agency and addresses client concerns.
steps: Navigate to 'Why Apex Partners' section on homepage
Verify three columns are displayed with equal spacing
Confirm first column covers luxury design aspects
Confirm second column covers development/technical quality
Confirm third column covers business/conversion focus
Test responsive behavior shows columns stacking on mobile

description: Four-step process overview on homepage: Discovery, Design, Build, Launch. Each step has brief description. Provides transparency and sets expectations for client engagement.
steps: Scroll to process section on homepage
Verify four steps are displayed in sequential order
Confirm each step has title and brief description
Verify step 1 is 'Discovery' with goals/audience/competitors text
Verify step 4 is 'Launch' with testing/handover/support text
Check visual styling matches luxury aesthetic with proper spacing

description: Three testimonial quotes with client names and business types (Restaurant Owner, Barber, Founder). Builds trust through social proof and demonstrates results across different client types.
steps: Navigate to testimonials section on homepage
Verify three testimonial cards/quotes are displayed
Confirm each testimonial includes quote text, name, and business type
Verify styling is consistent with luxury theme
Check that testimonials are readable and properly formatted
Test mobile layout for testimonial display

description: Final conversion section with headline 'Ready to upgrade your online presence?', supporting text, primary 'Request a Quote' button, and secondary 'Email us' link. Last opportunity to convert homepage visitors.
steps: Scroll to final CTA band at bottom of homepage
Verify headline and supporting text are displayed prominently
Click 'Request a Quote' button and confirm navigation to Contact page
Click 'Email us' link and verify it opens email client or navigates appropriately
Check styling matches luxury aesthetic with strong visual hierarchy
Test mobile responsiveness of CTA buttons

description: About page introduction with headline 'Built for brands that want to look premium.' and copy explaining agency positioning, from brochure sites to admin dashboards. Establishes credibility and scope of services.
steps: Navigate to About page via main navigation
Verify headline is prominently displayed at top of page
Confirm copy explains range from simple websites to full platforms
Check that text mentions luxury look and business-first thinking
Verify typography and spacing match luxury aesthetic
Test page loads correctly on mobile devices

description: Four core values section on About page: Clarity, Quality, Speed, Partnership. Each value has title and brief explanation. Communicates agency principles and working style to potential clients.
steps: Scroll to values section on About page
Verify all four values are displayed (Clarity, Quality, Speed, Partnership)
Confirm each value has descriptive text explaining the principle
Check visual layout presents values in organized grid or list
Verify styling is consistent with luxury minimalist theme
Test responsive behavior on mobile

description: Section describing target client types: restaurants, barbers, salons, local services, modern brands seeking premium presence. Helps visitors self-identify and understand if agency is right fit.
steps: Navigate to 'Who we work with' section on About page
Verify text lists restaurants, barbers, salons, local services, and brands
Confirm messaging emphasizes premium online presence
Check that section is clearly separated from other content
Verify typography and spacing are consistent
Test mobile display of this content

description: Call-to-action button on About page directing to quote request. Converts interested About page visitors into leads.
steps: Scroll to bottom of About page
Verify 'Request a Quote' button is prominently displayed
Click button and confirm navigation to Contact page
Check button styling matches global CTA design
Test button hover state shows inverted colors
Verify button is accessible and visible on mobile

description: Detailed service block for Starter Website with 'Best for', 'What's included' (1-3 pages, mobile responsive, basic SEO, contact form, social links, map), and outcome statement. Helps clients understand entry-level offering.
steps: Navigate to Services page
Locate Starter Website service block
Verify 'Best for' section mentions new businesses and personal brands
Confirm 'What's included' lists all 5 features (pages, responsive, SEO, form, social/map)
Verify outcome statement about professional online presence
Check styling and spacing match luxury aesthetic

description: Detailed service block for Business Website with 'Best for', 'What's included' (4-6 pages, conversion-focused homepage, service sections, FAQs, speed optimization, SEO), and outcome. Targets service businesses needing lead generation.
steps: Navigate to Business Website section on Services page
Verify 'Best for' targets service businesses needing leads
Confirm 'What's included' lists all features including conversion focus
Check that outcome mentions generating enquiries
Verify visual hierarchy separates this from other service blocks
Test mobile display of service details

description: Restaurant-specific service block with menu layouts, gallery, map/hours, book/order buttons linking to third-party platforms. Addresses specific needs of restaurant clients.
steps: Locate Restaurant Website section on Services page
Verify 'Best for' mentions restaurants, cafés, takeaways
Confirm includes menu page, gallery, map, hours, and CTA buttons
Check outcome statement about luxury feel matching venue
Verify all features are clearly listed
Test responsive layout on mobile

description: Barber/salon-specific service block with services/pricing layout, gallery, testimonials, local presence design, and 'Book now' button. Targets grooming industry clients.
steps: Navigate to Barber/Salon Website section on Services page
Verify 'Best for' targets barbers, salons, grooming studios
Confirm includes services/pricing, gallery, testimonials, local design
Check mentions 'Book now' button linking to booking platform
Verify outcome about building trust instantly
Test mobile display of this service block

description: E-commerce service block with storefront design, product/collection pages, conversion-focused UX, platform setup (Shopify/Woo). Targets brands selling products online.
steps: Locate E-Commerce Website section on Services page
Verify 'Best for' mentions brands selling products online
Confirm includes storefront, product pages, conversion UX, platform setup
Check outcome statement about designed to sell
Verify mentions specific platforms like Shopify/WooCommerce
Test responsive display of service details

description: Full-Service Platform block describing custom features, dashboards, admin panels, database functionality, scalable architecture. Targets businesses needing complex systems.
steps: Navigate to Full-Service Platform section on Services page
Verify 'Best for' mentions businesses needing systems
Confirm includes custom features, dashboards, admin tools, database functionality
Check mentions scalable architecture
Verify outcome about platform built for growth
Test mobile layout of this service block

description: Optional add-ons section listing maintenance, SEO, copywriting, branding/logos, hosting guidance. Provides upsell opportunities and comprehensive service awareness.
steps: Scroll to add-ons section on Services page
Verify all five add-ons are listed (maintenance, SEO, copywriting, branding, hosting)
Confirm section is visually separated from main services
Check that add-ons are clearly marked as optional
Verify styling is consistent with page design
Test mobile display of add-ons list

description: Process page with luxury timeline showing 5 steps: Kickoff & Discovery, Wireframe & Structure, High-end Design, Development & Testing, Launch & Support. Provides transparency about workflow and timeline expectations.
steps: Navigate to Process page
Verify all five steps are displayed in sequential timeline format
Confirm each step has clear title and description
Check visual design uses luxury timeline styling
Verify timeline note about typical durations (1-2 weeks starter, 2-4 weeks standard, custom)
Test mobile display of timeline

description: Pricing page showing six service tiers with 'Starting from' prices: Starter, Standard Business, Restaurant, Barber/Salon, E-Commerce (all with price placeholders), and Custom Platform (quote-based). Sets price expectations while maintaining flexibility.
steps: Navigate to Pricing page
Verify all six pricing tiers are displayed
Confirm each tier shows 'Starting from €XXX' except Custom Platform
Check Custom Platform shows 'Quote-based'
Verify pricing note about final pricing depending on scope is displayed
Test mobile layout of pricing cards

description: Pricing disclaimer note explaining that final pricing depends on pages, content, features, and timelines. Manages expectations and prevents pricing disputes.
steps: Scroll to pricing disclaimer on Pricing page
Verify note text mentions pages, content, features, and timelines
Confirm text is clearly visible and readable
Check styling differentiates it from pricing tiers
Verify placement is logical (near pricing or at bottom)
Test mobile display of disclaimer

description: Request a Quote CTA button on Pricing page to convert pricing page visitors into leads.
steps: Navigate to bottom of Pricing page
Verify 'Request a Quote' button is prominently displayed
Click button and confirm navigation to Contact page
Check button styling matches global CTA design
Test hover state shows proper interaction
Verify button is accessible on mobile

description: Portfolio page with grid of 6-12 projects displaying thumbnails, project names, and types. Provides visual showcase of agency work and quality.
steps: Navigate to Portfolio page
Verify grid displays between 6-12 project cards
Confirm each card shows thumbnail image, project name, and type
Check grid layout is responsive and maintains luxury aesthetic
Verify placeholder projects include Noir Bistro, Crown Cut Studio, etc.
Test mobile layout shows appropriate grid columns

description: Filter buttons on Portfolio page for categories: Restaurants, Barbers/Salons, Business, E-Commerce, Platforms. Allows visitors to view relevant work for their industry.
steps: Navigate to Portfolio page and locate filter buttons
Click 'Restaurants' filter and verify only restaurant projects display
Click 'Barbers/Salons' filter and verify filtering works
Click 'All' or reset and verify all projects display again
Test each filter category (Business, E-Commerce, Platforms)
Verify filter button styling shows active state

description: Individual case study pages/sections for each portfolio project with Overview, Goals, What we delivered, Result, and Screenshots. Provides detailed project context and demonstrates value delivery.
steps: Click on any portfolio project from grid
Verify case study view opens with project details
Confirm all sections are present: Overview, Goals, Deliverables, Result, Screenshots
Check that screenshots/images are displayed properly
Verify navigation back to portfolio grid works
Test mobile display of case study layout

description: Eight placeholder portfolio projects with names and types: Noir Bistro (Restaurant), Crown Cut Studio (Barber), Maison Café (Restaurant), Northmark Services (Business), Aurelia Skincare (E-Commerce), Silverline Studio (Premium Brand), District Dental (Local Service), Atlas Gym (Landing/Membership). Provides realistic content structure for launch.
steps: Navigate to Portfolio page
Verify Noir Bistro project is present and labeled as Restaurant
Verify Crown Cut Studio is present and labeled as Barber
Confirm all eight placeholder projects are displayed
Check each project has appropriate category tag
Verify clicking each project opens its case study

description: Contact form with fields: Full name, Email, Business name, Industry dropdown (Restaurant/Barber/Salon/Local Service/E-Commerce/Other), Budget range dropdown, Timeline dropdown, Message textarea, and 'Send enquiry' button. Primary lead capture mechanism.
steps: Navigate to Contact page
Verify all form fields are present and labeled correctly
Fill in Full name, Email, Business name, and Message fields
Click Industry dropdown and verify all six options are available
Click Budget range dropdown and verify options are present
Click Timeline dropdown and verify options are present
Click 'Send enquiry' button and verify form submission behavior

description: Contact page headline 'Request a quote.' with supporting text explaining service range. Sets context for form submission.
steps: Navigate to Contact page
Verify headline 'Request a quote.' is prominently displayed
Confirm supporting text mentions simple site or full platform
Check text mentions agency will guide the client
Verify typography matches luxury aesthetic
Test mobile display of headline section

description: Contact details section showing email (hello@apexpartners.com placeholder), social links, and location information. Provides alternative contact methods.
steps: Scroll to contact details section on Contact page
Verify email address placeholder is displayed
Confirm social media links (Instagram, LinkedIn) are present
Check location information is displayed if included
Verify styling is consistent with luxury theme
Test mobile display of contact details

description: Form action configured to mailto:hello@apexpartners.com as placeholder since no backend. Ensures form can function even without backend processing.
steps: Navigate to Contact page and fill out form completely
Click 'Send enquiry' button
Verify email client opens with pre-filled information OR appropriate fallback behavior
Check that form data is properly formatted in email
Test on different browsers for consistent behavior

description: FAQ page with 8 questions and answers: website timeline, client requirements, hosting/domains, redesign capability, maintenance, booking/ordering systems, admin panels/dashboards, payment process. Addresses common client concerns and reduces friction.
steps: Navigate to FAQ page
Verify all 8 FAQ items are displayed
Confirm question 1 addresses website timeline
Confirm question 7 addresses admin panels and dashboards
Check that answers are clear and informative
Verify styling uses luxury aesthetic with proper spacing

description: FAQ accordion/expandable functionality allowing users to click questions to reveal answers. Improves scanability and user experience.
steps: Navigate to FAQ page
Click on first FAQ question
Verify answer expands/reveals below question
Click question again and verify answer collapses
Test multiple FAQs can be open simultaneously or only one at a time
Verify smooth animation transitions (150-250ms)

description: Simple Privacy Policy page with standard template text covering basic privacy practices and cookie/analytics usage. Provides legal compliance and transparency.
steps: Navigate to Privacy Policy page (typically from footer link)
Verify page loads with privacy policy content
Confirm text covers data collection, usage, and cookies/analytics
Check that content is readable and properly formatted
Verify page styling matches site aesthetic
Test mobile display of policy text

description: All pages and components adapt to mobile screens with appropriate stacking, font sizing, and touch-friendly interactions. Ensures mobile-first approach as stated in brand positioning.
steps: Open site on mobile device or resize browser to mobile width (320px-768px)
Navigate through all pages and verify layouts adapt appropriately
Check that text remains readable without horizontal scrolling
Verify buttons and links are touch-friendly (minimum 44px touch targets)
Test hamburger menu opens and closes properly on mobile
Confirm images scale appropriately without breaking layout

description: Hamburger menu icon appearing on mobile that opens navigation overlay with all menu items and CTA button. Provides mobile navigation while maintaining clean header.
steps: Resize browser to mobile width or open on mobile device
Verify hamburger icon appears in header
Click/tap hamburger icon and verify menu overlay opens
Confirm all navigation links are present in mobile menu
Verify 'Request a Quote' CTA is visible in mobile menu
Click close icon or outside menu and verify menu closes

description: Consistent luxury aesthetic across all pages: black (#0B0B0B) and white (#FFFFFF) palette, grey text (#B8B8B8), border grey (#1E1E1E), optional champagne gold accent (#C6A15B), serif headings (Playfair Display/Cormorant), sans body (Inter/Helvetica), generous spacing, thin separators. Establishes premium brand perception.
steps: Navigate through all pages of site
Verify primary black (#0B0B0B) is used for backgrounds/primary elements
Confirm white (#FFFFFF) is used appropriately for contrast
Check grey text (#B8B8B8) is used for secondary content
Verify headings use elegant serif font (Playfair Display or similar)
Confirm body text uses modern sans-serif (Inter or similar)
Check spacing is generous with strong grid alignment

description: All buttons show inverted hover states (black to white, white to black) with smooth transitions. Provides interactive feedback matching luxury aesthetic.
steps: Navigate to any page with buttons (Home, Contact, etc.)
Hover over primary CTA button and verify color inverts
Check transition is smooth (150-250ms)
Test secondary buttons also have hover states
Verify hover states work on all button types across site
Test focus states are visible for keyboard navigation

description: Subtle fade/slide animations on page elements with 150-250ms transitions. Adds polish and premium feel without being distracting.
steps: Navigate to homepage and scroll through sections
Observe elements fading or sliding in as they enter viewport
Verify animations are subtle and not jarring
Check transition timing is between 150-250ms
Test animations work smoothly on different browsers
Verify animations don't cause performance issues on mobile

description: All images use black and white photography (architecture, interiors, city, workspaces) with maximum one strong hero visual per page. Portfolio thumbnails are monochrome mockups. Maintains consistent luxury aesthetic.
steps: Navigate through all pages and examine images
Verify all photography is black and white or monochrome
Confirm each page has maximum one hero image
Check portfolio thumbnails are monochrome mockups
Verify images match luxury aesthetic (architecture, interiors, etc.)
Test images load properly and are optimized

description: Consistent corner radius treatment (6-10px subtle rounded OR sharp corners) applied to all cards, buttons, and containers. Maintains design system consistency.
steps: Navigate through all pages examining UI elements
Check all buttons have consistent corner radius
Verify all cards use same corner radius treatment
Confirm containers and boxes follow same radius pattern
Check that choice (rounded vs sharp) is consistent site-wide
Test visual consistency across different components

description: Each page has unique meta title and description optimized for SEO. Improves search visibility and click-through rates.
steps: View page source or inspect head element on Home page
Verify unique meta title and description tags are present
Navigate to About page and verify different meta tags
Check Services, Portfolio, Pricing, Contact pages each have unique meta tags
Verify meta descriptions are compelling and include relevant keywords
Test Open Graph tags are present for social sharing

description: Proper H1/H2/H3 heading hierarchy on all pages for SEO and accessibility. Ensures content structure is logical and crawlable.
steps: Inspect HTML structure of Home page
Verify single H1 tag is present (main headline)
Confirm H2 tags are used for major sections
Check H3 tags are used for subsections appropriately
Test heading hierarchy is logical and sequential
Verify all pages follow consistent heading structure

description: Images are optimized for fast loading with appropriate formats, compression, and lazy loading. Ensures fast page performance as promised in brand positioning.
steps: Navigate to image-heavy pages (Home, Portfolio)
Check page load time is fast (under 3 seconds)
Verify images are compressed without visible quality loss
Test lazy loading - images below fold load as user scrolls
Check images use modern formats (WebP with fallbacks)
Test performance on slower connections

description: Black and white branded Open Graph image for social media sharing. Ensures professional appearance when site is shared on social platforms.
steps: View page source and locate og:image meta tag
Verify Open Graph image URL is present
Test sharing site URL on Facebook or LinkedIn
Confirm branded black and white image appears in share preview
Check image dimensions are appropriate (1200x630px recommended)
Verify image loads quickly and displays correctly
